wikipedia_page.main: Sir John Huxtable Elliott  (born 23 June 1930) is an English historian, Regius Professor Emeritus at the University of Oxford and Honorary Fellow of Oriel College, Oxford, and Trinity College, Cambridge. He publishes under the name J. H. Elliott.

response: *  1930   – John Elliott, English historian and academic

Cardinal Cisneros' life coincided with, and greatly influenced, a dynamic period in the history of Spain during the reign of Ferdinand II of Aragon and Isabella I of Castile. During this time Spain underwent many significant changes, leading it into its prominent role in the Spanish Golden Age (1500–1700). Modern historian John Elliott said as far as any particular policies that can be attributed to Spain's rise, they were those of King Ferdinand and Cardinal Cisneros.Rummel (1999), pg.1

* John Elliott (defensive lineman) (1944–2010), American football defensive tackle
* John Elliott (physician) (fl. 1690), adherent of James II
* John Elliott (businessman) (1941–2021), Australian businessman and prominent Liberal
